page.title: 09PENYBONT PRIMARY,BRIDGEND.
page.content: The school was officialy opened in 1900 by the Lord of Dunraven as an intermediate school. The buildings are made of brick, sandstone, wood with pitch and slate roofing. Our school is on a piece of land 3276 sqm. It has a variety of trees around the perimeter. The children use a variety of equipment to help them learn. The most important are the video, television, computer, hi-fi and photocopier. During lunchtime and after school children are involved in a variety of clubs. Adult societies use the school in the evenings. The children study many subjects from science to art. Some are included in project work. Each class completes 3 projects a year.
